#summary Release Early. Release Often

 # Load all the latest code from `http://www.squeaksource.com/Seaside30/` and `http://www.squeaksource.com/Seaside30LGPL` (ready made images are available from the [http://hudson.lukas-renggli.ch/job/Seaside%203.0/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/ build-server].
   # Run the unit tests and make sure they all pass. 
   # Click through the functional test suite using the all server adaptors and all different encodings.
 # Load `Package-Dependencies` from `http://source.lukas-renggli.ch/packaging`.
  # You will need `GraphViz` packages from there too
  # Generate the graph `PDPackageAnalyzer seaside` and make sure the dependencies are valid.
  # Export as SVG and PNG versions and include them with the release.
 # Prepare a list of [http://code.google.com/p/seaside/issues/csv?can=1&q=&colspec=ID+Type+Status+Priority+Version+Platform+Owner+Summary+Milestone+Stars+Opened+Closed+Modified+BlockedOn+Blocking+Blocked+MergedInto+Reporter+Cc+Release&cells=tiles resolved issues].
 # Upload image and one-click distribution to website; update links (`http://www.seaside.st/download/pharo` and `http://www.seaside.st/design/parts/download`).
 # Update PastReleases. 
 # Announce the release in the mailing list.
 # Repeat forever.

Suggested script to setup the image:
{{{
Workspace new
	contents: 'Welcome to Seaside 3.0.

Seaside is already running on port 8080. To get started, simply use your browser to open http://localhost:8080/ and take a look at the examples and documentation listed there.

You can start and stop the server (and change the port) using the new Seaside Control Panel, which is open in the bottom left corner.';
	openLabel: 'Seaside 3.0'.

WAKom startOn: 8080.
WAServerAdaptorBrowser open.

"Position the windows!!!"
